http://johanbrook.com/browsers/native-momentum-scrolling-ios-5/
Scrolling feels much better with momentum scrolling. Maybe you can use it in your picker dialog?

We already use "-webkit-overflow-scrolling: touch" inside our framework.
The problem with this feature: It only works good on iOS devices (still buggy even on iOS7). Android and Blackberry supports the feature, but the performance is not as great as on iOS devices.
The Picker scrolling has to be cross-browser, and implementing the widget with "scrolling: touch" would require a fallback with iScroll. That means, the Picker would create x instance of iScroll for each picker slot.
Another problem: an iScroll inside another iScroll behaves weird.
I think this is too much complexity for this widget.

So, progressive enhancement for browsers which support "scrolling: touch" is not an option, because it's not cross-browser per definitionem?
In this case and from my point of view, you can close this bug.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 8487 ***
